summary: Email chain between Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York and attorney Sigrid McCawley regarding a request for journal entries and other documents from a witness (name redacted) related to her experiences with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The AUSA acknowledges receipt of photographs and seeks additional materials to assist the investigation.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, attorney for a witness
persons.context: Attorney communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office about providing evidence from her client, including photographs and potentially journal entries, related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a central figure in the experiences documented by the witness whose evidence is being sought.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named alongside Epstein as a central figure in the experiences documented by the witness whose evidence is being sought.

connections.description: McCawley, as an attorney, is facilitating the provision of evidence from a witness regarding experiences with Epstein.
McCawley, as an attorney, is facilitating the provision of evidence from a witness regarding experiences with Maxwell.
Referred to together as the subjects of the witness's experiences and the ongoing investigation.

events.title: Email Correspondence Regarding Evidence Request
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney follows up with attorney Sigrid McCawley to request journal entries and other documents from a witness to assist in the investigation of Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: Witness Interview
events.description: A witness (name redacted) was interviewed by the U.S. Attorney's Office a few months prior, during which she referenced journal entries about her experiences with Epstein and Maxwell.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, 401 E. Las Olas Blvd. Suite 1200, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33301
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively investigating Epstein and Maxwell as of January 2020.
A witness had provided photographs to the investigation and possessed journal entries that detailed her experiences with Epstein and Maxwell.
The prosecution considered the witness's journal entries to be very helpful for refreshing her recollection and advancing the investigation.
Attorney Sigrid McCawley was acting as intermediary between the witness and the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The correspondence highlights the methodical evidence-gathering process of the investigation, seeking personal records like journals.
